content.description: Use small crimps and small left-facing corner to pull the first couple bouldery moves up to overhang. Pull overhang up to a small right-facing flake and up to ledge. Climb straight past small, right-facing, slanted corner to top. The whole route stays fairly parallel to Skink
content.protection: TR recommended. If you don't redirect the double bolted anchor, then watch for swing at the start. Pro did not look too adequate at all.
content.location: A few feet right and down from the start of Skink. Starts directly under the small overhang created by the large left-facing flake of Skink

content.description: This is in the guidebook at 5.6, and is one of the biggest sandbags I've ever seen at that grade - IF you're under 5'9".  If you're tall, it'll go perhaps 5.7.  If you're short, it goes 5.8 easily.  It took me two years to figure out, and the move I use isn't at all obvious.
content.protection: G-PG pro, depending on which way you go up.  Opening moves are TRES scary, with nasty fall; good idea to have spotter or crashpad.  Double-bolted anchor at top.
content.location: On the flat wall (large, detached block) to left of Golden Dream/Slot Machine.  Climb left-facing flake and face above.  Can stand on top of flake and move right ~5' if needsbe.  Climbing straight through (direct) without standing on flake is possible, but will go 5.9 if you're short, 5.8 if you're tall.  Easy walk-off.

content.description: Never done this one; only including it for completeness.  Those that have, gave me the info on gear et al.
content.protection: Very little gear to be found.  No anchor at the top - either run a directional with the Skink anchor, or go ALL THE WAY across to the other side of the detached block for gear; use static line to reach the route.
content.location: Climb face between Skink and the arete to the left (Scoop Arete), up past small pine tree.

content.description: Climb the far left arete of the large, detached block (left of Scoop Face and Skink), past the "scooped out" section. Crux is there.
content.protection: PG pro.  Gear-only anchor, around a single block.
content.location: Far left arete of large, detached block (left of Scoop Face and Skink).  Easy walk-off.

content.description: On the backside of the Skink wall, accessed to the right via the canyon, climb the less than vertical chimney canyon to the top of the Skink block. Some nice chimney moves.
content.location: On the backside of the Skink wall, accessed to the right via the canyon, then follow the ledge on the left to the mouth of the canyon slot.

content.description: Lou's wall is the big southeast-facing block opposite the obvious corner of Golden Dream.
